title: LC-Score: Reference-less estimation of Text Comprehension Difficulty. (arXiv:2310.02754v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Being able to read and understand written text is critical in a digital era. However, studies shows that a large fraction of the population experiences comprehension issues. In this context, further initiatives in accessibility are required to improve the audience text comprehension. However, writers are hardly assisted nor encouraged to produce easy-to-understand content. Moreover, Automatic Text Simplification (ATS) model development suffers from the lack of metric to accurately estimate comprehension difficulty We present \textsc{LC-Score}, a simple approach for training text comprehension metric for any French text without reference \ie predicting how easy to understand a given text is on a $[0, 100]$ scale. translated_abstract: 在数字时代，能够阅读和理解书面文本是至关重要的。然而，研究表明，大部分人口都存在理解障碍。在这种背景下，需要进一步的无障碍倡议来提高受众的文本理解能力。然而，作家们几乎没有得到支持或鼓励以创作易于理解的内容。此外，自动文本简化（ATS）模型的开发缺乏准确估计理解难度的度量标准。我们提出了\textsc{LC-Score}，一种简单的方法来训练文本理解度量标准，用于法语文本而无需参考，即预测给定文本在$[0, 100]$范围内的易读程度。我们的目标是定量捕捉文本符合\textit{Langage Clair}（LC，即\textit{Clear Language}）指南的程度，该指南与英语简明语言密切相关。我们探索了两种方法：（i）使用语言学方法
tldr: 本文提出了一种无参考评估文本理解困难度的简单方法LC-Score，可以用于法语文本，该方法可以预测给定文本在0到100范围内的易读程度。这个方法可以帮助作家们创作易于理解的内容，并提供度量标准来评估自动化文本简化模型的发展。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a simple approach called LC-Score for estimating text comprehension difficulty without reference. It can be used for French text and predicts the readability of a given text on a scale from 0 to 100. The method aims to assist writers in producing easy-to-understand content and provide a metric for evaluating the development of automatic text simplification models.
